researchPage.faqSubtitle: Common questions about CBD research and how to use this database
researchPage.faqCbdResearch: Is CBD backed by scientific research?
researchPage.faqCbdResearchAnswer: Yes. We index peer-reviewed studies from PubMed, ClinicalTrials.gov, and other authoritative medical databases. Research quality varies—use our filters and quality scores to find the most robust evidence.
researchPage.faqMedicallyApprovedAnswer: Most CBD products are sold as food supplements, not approved medicines. However, Epidiolex (prescription CBD) is approved in multiple countries for treating seizures.
researchPage.faqConditions: What health conditions have CBD research?
researchPage.faqConditionsAnswer: The most-researched conditions include epilepsy, anxiety disorders, chronic pain, sleep problems, and inflammatory conditions. Use the condition filters to explore studies for specific health topics.
researchPage.faqHealthDecisions: Can I use this research to make health decisions?
researchPage.faqHealthDecisionsAnswer: This database is for educational purposes only. We aggregate published research but do not provide medical advice. Always consult a healthcare professional before using CBD.
researchPage.qualityScoresDesc: Learn how we evaluate and score research quality to help you find the most reliable evidence.
researchPage.disclaimer: All research indexed here is from third-party sources. We do not own or claim copyright over the original studies.

dosageCalc.title: CBD Dosage Calculator
dosageCalc.subtitle: Get personalized CBD dosing recommendations based on current research
dosageCalc.whyIndividualDesc: CBD affects everyone differently due to factors like metabolism, body chemistry, medical conditions, and product quality. What works for one person may not work for another.
dosageCalc.startLowDesc: The golden rule of CBD dosing is to start with a low dose and gradually increase until you find what works for you. This approach minimizes side effects and helps you find your optimal dose.
dosageCalc.productQualityDesc: Always choose third-party tested products with Certificates of Analysis (COAs) to ensure you're getting accurate potency and purity information.
dosageCalc.medicalSupervisionDesc: If you're treating a medical condition, especially epilepsy or other serious conditions, work with a healthcare provider experienced in cannabis medicine.
dosageCalc.researchBasedDesc: Our calculator uses dosing guidelines from published clinical research and expert recommendations to provide science-based starting points.

strengthCalc.title: CBD Strength Calculator
strengthCalc.subtitle: Convert, calculate, and compare CBD product strengths
strengthCalc.mostCommon: Most common strength for daily use
strengthCalc.forExperienced: For experienced users or specific needs
strengthCalc.dropSizeNote: Standard dropper: ~0.05ml per drop. Thicker oils may have larger drops.
strengthCalc.switchingDesc: Calculate equivalent drops when changing to a different strength oil.
strengthCalc.tipText: When switching to a stronger oil, you'll need fewer drops. Start with the calculated amount and adjust based on how you feel.
strengthCalc.percentVsMgDesc: A 5% CBD oil contains 50mg of CBD per ml. The formula: percentage × 10 = mg/ml. So 10% oil = 100mg/ml, and 3% oil = 30mg/ml.
strengthCalc.totalMgBottleDesc: Total mg depends on both strength AND bottle size. A 10ml bottle of 5% oil contains 500mg total, while a 30ml bottle of the same strength contains 1500mg.
strengthCalc.dropsPerMlDesc: Standard droppers dispense about 20 drops per ml (0.05ml each). Thicker oils may have slightly larger drops. Our calculator uses this standard but allows adjustments.
strengthCalc.disclaimerText: This calculator provides general information for educational purposes. CBD dosing is highly individual. Always start with lower doses and consult a healthcare professional, especially if you take medications.

interactionChecker.title: CBD Drug Interaction Checker
interactionChecker.subtitle: Check potential interactions between CBD and your medications
interactionChecker.howCBDInteractsDesc: CBD (cannabidiol) can affect how your body processes certain medications through the cytochrome P450 enzyme system. The most significant interactions involve:
interactionChecker.majorDesc: Avoid this combination unless under close medical supervision. Significant risk of adverse effects.
interactionChecker.moderateDesc: Use with caution. Monitor for side effects and consider timing separation or dose adjustments.
interactionChecker.minorDesc: Low risk interaction. Be aware of potential effects but generally considered safe.
interactionChecker.unknownDesc: Insufficient research data. Exercise caution and consult your healthcare provider.
interactionChecker.faqHowInteract: How does CBD interact with medications?
interactionChecker.faqHowInteractAnswer: CBD primarily interacts with medications through the cytochrome P450 enzyme system in the liver. CBD can inhibit certain CYP enzymes (especially CYP3A4 and CYP2C19), which can slow down how your body processes certain drugs. This may lead to higher levels of the medication in your blood.
interactionChecker.faqStopMedication: Should I stop my medication to use CBD?
interactionChecker.faqStopMedicationAnswer: Never stop or change your prescribed medications without consulting your doctor. If you want to use CBD, discuss it with your healthcare provider first. They can advise on potential interactions, timing, and whether any medication adjustments are needed.
interactionChecker.faqDifferentTime: Can I take CBD at a different time than my medication?
interactionChecker.faqDifferentTimeAnswer: While spacing CBD and medications apart may reduce some interactions, it doesn't eliminate them. CBD has a long half-life and its effects on liver enzymes can persist. Always consult your healthcare provider about timing strategies.
interactionChecker.faqAccuracy: How accurate is this interaction checker?
interactionChecker.faqAccuracyAnswer: This tool is based on current published research and provides general guidance. However, individual responses vary, and new interactions may be discovered. It should not replace professional medical advice. Always consult your doctor or pharmacist for personalised guidance.

costCalc.title: CBD Cost Calculator
costCalc.subtitle: Compare CBD product costs per milligram to find the best value
costCalc.totalCBDHint: Total CBD in the entire product (not per serving)
costCalc.productSizeHint: For oils: bottle size in ml. For gummies/capsules: number of pieces
costCalc.rememberTip1: Price isn't everything — always verify product quality with third-party lab tests (COAs)
costCalc.rememberTip2: Full-spectrum products may offer additional benefits over isolates
costCalc.rememberTip3: Consider shipping costs and subscription discounts when comparing
costCalc.realValueDesc: CBD products vary wildly in price and potency. A {{currency}}30 bottle with 500mg CBD is actually more expensive than a {{currency}}50 bottle with 1500mg CBD when you calculate the cost per milligram.
costCalc.howToCalculateDesc: Cost per mg = Total Price / Total CBD Content. For example, a {{currency}}60 bottle containing 1000mg CBD costs {{currency}}0.06 per mg.
costCalc.qualityMattersDesc: The cheapest option isn't always the best. Always check for third-party lab testing (COA) to verify potency and purity. A slightly more expensive product with verified quality may be worth it.
costCalc.goodPriceDesc: Generally, {{currency}}0.05-0.10 per mg is considered reasonable for quality CBD oil. Prices below {{currency}}0.03/mg may indicate lower quality, while premium brands often charge {{currency}}0.15+ per mg.
costCalc.tipText: Add 2-3 products you're considering to quickly see which offers the best value for your budget.
costCalc.disclaimerText: This calculator is for informational purposes only. Always verify CBD content from the product's Certificate of Analysis (COA). Prices and formulations may vary by retailer and over time.

animalDosageCalc.title: Animal CBD Dosage Calculator
animalDosageCalc.subtitle: Veterinary-guided CBD dosing recommendations for dogs, cats, horses, and other animals
animalDosageCalc.prescriptionMeds: My pet currently takes prescription medications
animalDosageCalc.vetConsulted: I have discussed CBD use with my veterinarian
animalDosageCalc.howToGive: How to Give to Your Pet
animalDosageCalc.whyDifferentDesc: Animals metabolize CBD very differently than humans. Dogs, cats, horses, and other species have unique liver enzymes, body compositions, and sensitivities that require species-specific dosing protocols.
animalDosageCalc.startLow: Start Very Low, Go Very Slow
animalDosageCalc.startLowDesc: Unlike humans who can report side effects, animals cannot communicate discomfort. Always start with the minimum effective dose and increase gradually while monitoring closely.
animalDosageCalc.neverHumanDesc: Human CBD products often contain xylitol, chocolate, or other ingredients that are toxic to animals. Always use products specifically formulated for pets.
animalDosageCalc.vetSupervisionDesc: CBD can interact with medications and may not be appropriate for animals with certain health conditions. Your veterinarian can provide guidance specific to your pet's needs.
animalDosageCalc.evidenceBasedDesc: Our animal dosing recommendations are based on veterinary research and clinical experience with CBD use in animals, adjusted for safety and efficacy.

authorBio.authorTitle: CBD Products Expert, Industry Pioneer & Co-founder of Formula Swiss AG
authorBio.authorBio: Swiss entrepreneur, CBD products expert, and CBD industry pioneer who co-founded Formula Swiss AG in 2013. With over 12 years of hands-on experience and extensive academic background (studied at university 4 times), he has served 100,000+ customers across 60+ countries and developed 300+ CBD product formulations under GMP certification standards. Robin is also recognized as an expert on European cannabis laws and is well-known for his legal advocacy work, including ongoing cases against regulatory authorities.
authorBio.disclaimerText: The views and opinions expressed in these articles are Robin's personal expert opinions based on his extensive industry experience and independent research. They do not represent the official position of any company or organization he has founded or been affiliated with.

cookiePolicy.pageDescription: Information about how CBD Portal uses cookies.
cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.whatAreCookiesText: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.
cookiePolicy.howWeUseCookiesText: CBD Portal uses cookies for the following purposes:
cookiePolicy.essentialCookiesText: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as security, network management, and accessibility.
cookiePolicy.analyticsCookiesText: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.
cookiePolicy.preferenceCookiesText: These cookies remember your preferences and settings to enhance your experience.
cookiePolicy.thirdPartyCookiesText: Some cookies are placed by third-party services that appear on our pages. We do not control these cookies. Third parties that may set cookies include:
cookiePolicy.thirdPartyGoogleAnalyticsText: For website analytics and performance monitoring
cookiePolicy.thirdPartyVercelText: Our hosting provider may set performance-related cookies
cookiePolicy.managingCookiesText: Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can:
cookiePolicy.managingCookiesOption1: View what cookies are stored on your device
cookiePolicy.managingCookiesOption6: Receive a warning before a cookie is stored
cookiePolicy.impactText: If you disable cookies, some features of our website may not function properly. Essential cookies cannot be disabled as they are necessary for the site to work.
cookiePolicy.doNotTrackText: Some browsers have a "Do Not Track" feature that signals to websites that you do not want to have your online activity tracked. Our Site currently does not respond to "Do Not Track" signals.
cookiePolicy.updatesText: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.
cookiePolicy.contactText: If you have questions about our use of cookies, please contact us at:

methodology.pageDescription: Learn how CBD Portal evaluates and scores research quality. Our transparent 0-100 scoring system assesses study design, methodology, sample size, and relevance.
methodology.title: How We Assess Research Quality
methodology.subtitle: At CBD Portal, we evaluate every study using a transparent, evidence-based scoring system. Here's exactly how it works.
methodology.scoringSystemDesc: Every study receives a quality score based on four factors:
methodology.studyDesignDesc: The type of study determines the maximum evidence quality:
methodology.sampleSizeDesc: Larger studies provide more reliable results:
methodology.highQualityCardDesc: Results you can have reasonable confidence in
methodology.lowQualityCardDesc: Interesting but don't base decisions on it alone
methodology.transparencyItem1: We show the exact score breakdown on every study page
methodology.transparencyItem2: Our methodology is consistent across all studies in our database
methodology.transparencyItem3: We update scores when new information becomes available
methodology.transparencyItem4: We never adjust scores based on whether results favor CBD
methodology.limitationsItem2: A high score doesn't mean CBD "works" for a condition
methodology.limitationsItem3: A low score doesn't mean the research is worthless
methodology.limitationsItem4: Individual studies should be considered alongside the full body of research
methodology.questionsDesc: We're happy to explain our approach in more detail.

editorialPolicy.metaDescription: Learn about CBD Portal editorial standards and research methodology.
editorialPolicy.title: Editorial Policy
editorialPolicy.subtitle: How we research, write, and maintain accurate CBD information.
editorialPolicy.commitmentText: CBD Portal is committed to providing accurate, evidence-based information about cannabidiol and related topics. We understand that health-related decisions require trustworthy information, and we take this responsibility seriously.
editorialPolicy.writersText: All content on CBD Portal is written by verified industry experts with real-world experience in CBD product development, research, or healthcare. Our authors have:
editorialPolicy.writersItem1: Demonstrated expertise in the CBD or cannabis industry
editorialPolicy.sourceText: We prioritize peer-reviewed research from reputable journals. Our primary sources include:
editorialPolicy.sourceItem4: Major medical journals (JAMA, BMJ, Lancet, etc.)
editorialPolicy.qualityText: We evaluate research quality based on:
editorialPolicy.qualityItem1: Study design (randomized controlled trials weighted highest)
editorialPolicy.balancedText: We present research findings honestly, including:
editorialPolicy.balancedItem3: Areas where evidence is limited or preliminary
editorialPolicy.balancedItem4: Clear distinction between human and animal studies
editorialPolicy.citationText: Every factual claim in our articles is supported by citations. We use:
editorialPolicy.citationItem1: Inline citations linking directly to source material
editorialPolicy.citationItem2: Reference lists at the end of each article
editorialPolicy.citationItem3: Clear attribution of quotes and statistics
editorialPolicy.disclaimerText: Our content is for informational purposes only. We always recommend that readers:
editorialPolicy.disclaimerItem1: Consult healthcare professionals before using CBD
editorialPolicy.disclaimerItem2: Discuss potential drug interactions with their doctor
editorialPolicy.disclaimerItem3: Not replace prescribed treatments with CBD
editorialPolicy.disclaimerItem4: Be cautious of any source making guaranteed health claims
editorialPolicy.updatesText: CBD research is rapidly evolving. We commit to:
editorialPolicy.updatesItem2: Updating content when significant new research emerges
editorialPolicy.updatesItem3: Clearly displaying "last updated" dates on all articles
editorialPolicy.updatesItem4: Noting when articles have been substantially revised
editorialPolicy.correctionsText: If we make an error, we will:
editorialPolicy.correctionsItem2: Note the correction at the bottom of the article
editorialPolicy.correctionsItem3: Preserve transparency about what was changed
editorialPolicy.correctionsLink: To report an error or suggest a correction, please
editorialPolicy.conflictsText: We believe in transparency. Our authors disclose:
editorialPolicy.conflictsItem1: Current or past employment in the CBD industry
editorialPolicy.conflictsItem3: Any relationships that could influence content
editorialPolicy.independenceText: CBD Portal maintains editorial independence. We:
editorialPolicy.independenceItem1: Do not accept payment for favorable coverage
editorialPolicy.independenceItem2: Clearly label any sponsored content (which is rare)
editorialPolicy.independenceItem3: Base recommendations solely on evidence and expert judgment
editorialPolicy.questionsText: We welcome questions about our editorial process. Please
